comment: Super easy class. Very late grader. Interesting class material. Open note quizzes. Three written essay exams. No textbooks. Relaxed atmosphere. Drops two lowest quiz grades. Better history class than HS. Easy A, just do the work.

Super boring prof who goes off on random tangents all the time. Nobody payed attention to his lectures and he was always unsure of assignments and whatnot. Very knowledgeable, but overall boring and with no direction. Only grades were a few quizzes, midterm, and a final. Overall a pretty easy class, but you won't learn much.

He's very nice and is clearly passionate about history. However, he often went on tangents that caused the class to be incredibly behind at the end of the semester. He had easy weekly quizzes and only a midterm and final. I found it difficult to take notes in lecture because he would get off track. Overall, not bad for a mundane history course.

The due dates kept changing so sometimes it was hard to keep up but it was okay because he mainly kept pushing the due date back. It was hard for me to keep up with the lectures because they were two hours long and they seemed to jump back and forth. Dr. Patton is really passionate about his teaching though and encourages participation.

I've taken 2 courses with Dr. Patton now and have enjoyed both a lot! He is one of the most knowledgeable professors I've had and is very passionate about the material. He is a lenient grader and provides so much supplementary material that if you engage in the course, you will learn SO much. Answers emails quickly and is very understanding!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: professor patton is so animated and his lectures keep your attention. I've taken a few of his classes and received A's in both. highly recommend
Patton is awesome and his class isn't stressful. Really recommend him.
If you love history, he is the perfect professor who knows every detail and has a ardent passion for American history. However, if history isn't your thing, you will not like him.

The class wasn't hard, but it was very boring. Dr. Patton is a nice guy, but all he did was talk. The class wasn't engaging. 95% of the class was on their phone or laptop while he lectured. The class was always half empty. I feel I didn't gain anything from the class. I'm just happy I got a good grade.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You can do well in this class just by paying attention to the informative, well-organized and witty lectures. Where you can really learn a lot more about the subject, if you care to, is the supplemental readings he makes available. He doesn't keep after you to read it and you can handle tests without most -- but look at them, they're good stuff.

I had him for a senior research seminar, so I can't say much about his regular classes. He was really good about helping me with finding a direction and sources for my paper. And when I fried my computer just before the final paper was due, he was really nice about giving me an extra couple days to rewrite it. Good guy.

Professor Patton is very passionate about teaching. He's very laid back and lectures while sitting on top of his desk. Every class was a lecture but almost all of them were extremely interesting because of how he taught. Test were short and long essays and not difficult at all. Patton is a great down to earth guy who wants you to succeed. Take him!
Lectures are interesting, will go off topic a lot. The papers aren't very hard and he puts up study guides for the tests. Books are required
You need to learn the material, but he basically gives you the questions to his tests. Not super challenging but you still learn a lot. Would recommend for history majors.

Dr. Patton is very knowledgeable about U.S. Southern and Economic/Business History. While some of the economic history towards the end of the class was done in broad brush strokes, he is very passionate about teaching. Also, Dr. Patton cares much about his students. He is a very good and precise lecturer. He is also very "down to earth" person.

Dr. Patton is a walking encyclopedia of knowledge about the south. He lectures every class period but for the most part they were interesting. Test are essay test but he gives a study guide and takes questions straight from them. Final was essay and an option to do it online. Great professor! Attendance is also not mandatory and not really needed.
awesome teacher! really nice and enthusiastic about teaching... he explains things well and his lectures are very helpful. i would definitely recommend him. he's very funny as well!

Great guy. Took him as much as possible and enjoyed classes. Straight lectures everyday and videos a lot of the time also. Test were easy and most of the time take home. Understands the hectic schedule of college kids so missing class wont hurt you at all. I prob went half the time. Just watching him laugh at his jokes everyday kept me interested.

I had Dr. Patton for Recent U.S. History. I really enjoyed the class. There were several little research papers to write 3-5 pages. The midterm and finals were either take home or partly take home-partly in class 50:50. Make sure to read the textbook, come to class, take notes, and participate. He was very flexible and helpful. I liked him a lot.

Easiest A I've ever gotten. Posted most assignments online along with resources to do them with. Take home midterm and final with a few 1 pg papers, very very easy. I didn't go to class at all after spring break and still made an easy A. Patton is an awesome dude

He's an incredibly nice man, but the Business History class was dull and ridiculously easy. I barely went and made an A because the tests were at-home (e-mail your answers to him), and the book summaries were completion grades. I would recommend him, but not because he's interesting.

I have had Patton for several Classes now.  He is a wonderful lecturer, and extremely knowledgeable of his field.  His lectures are upbeat and informative.  The work is not heavy; a take home midterm and final and lengthy research paper with presentation.  I would take him for every History Class if I could.

Have had him 3 classes now and would take him for every class if I could. Wonderful teacher and a great guy. Everything on the tests comes from notes or videos/movies. Usually just 2 tests, all essays and possibly a paper or two, but nothing terrible.
Erudite. Jocular. Interesting.

He is a very smart guy, who knows everything he is talking about. If you are interested in History then I recommend taking him because he is interesting and fun to listen to. He takes a lot of pride in what he teaches and you can tell he wants to be there lecturing. His test are not very hard. The midterm was take-home. I would recommend him.

Though he is a little weird, he'll grow on you.  First Dr. I've had that hasn't been arrogant and self-important.  Knows a lot of stuff and is very interesting, but might be boring to those of you not interested in history.
Read the text, show up for tests.  Study guides posted online.

I took him for New South. I Didn't like him at first, but he is goofy and grows on you. He laughs at his own jokes and really knows his stuff. He'll work with the class to the point that students could take advantage, but is a really nice guy. I would take him again any time I could.

Hardest part about this class were the fact that the midterm was a 15 to 25 page, 5 essay test. Final was a bit less. There was also a presentation...no big deal...and an 8-10 page paper. Lots of reading for a 6 week course. Seminar style. I would take again.

Best professor ever. Very helpful. His lectures are very clear and were interesting considering the subject. One 8 - 10 page paper, not too bad. 3 tests and he doesn't grade very harshly. He gets tests back very quickly. I am taking another class with him. He is awesome.

Took this class because I needed a history. Had no interest at all in the subject, but Dr Patton makes it very interesting. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subject. Very fair, will make sure you know what's on the tests.
He is the best professor ever. He knows his material very well. I enjoyed the class a lot.

Hands down the only good history class I've had at this stupid school!  Dr. Patton is a wealth of information and he ENCOURAGES and enjoys discussion and listening to others' opinions and ideas about topics of study.  A true graduate level class (unlike some of our others)!!!  I wish Dr. Patton could have taught all of them for us!

Easiest class I've ever taken.  I am a business major and I never had to go to the class.  If you like your grades on your first two exams you don't have to take the final.  I wish I could have gone to class more though as he was very interesting and humorous.  He likes his job and he wants you to like his class and learn something too!

He's kind of goofy, but his lectures are very easy to listen to. Most of the material on the tests come from reading in this class. Subject is extremely boring (economic history), but he makes it interesting. Very knowledgeable about this subject!
SUPER teacher!  HE has an incredible knowledge of history and economics and has fabulous discussions!  GREAT class!  I learned a TON!
He is the best teacher you will ever have period, on the testing end!  His classes might get a little boring, but he is cool!!  He knows exactly what he talking about!  Tests are easy.
One of the best History professors at KSU, if not the best. Can teach to anyone and make History fun. If you can't pass a Patton class, then you shouldn't take a history class. Always helpful.

Great Professor, He is very funny he laughs at his own jokes. I would go to class just to see what he would do.  His test were harder than expected but he understands that students have alot on their plate.  In our class he came in and asked us if we were ready for our test over half the class said "no", so he moved the test back a week.
Professor Patton is by far one of the best at Kennesaw State University.
Wonderful teacher. His tests weren't bad at all. He gave you many different topics that you could choose from to write short essays on. He obviously enjoys teaching.
Impossible to get in touch with outside of class unless you go to his office.  Really knows his subject.  Very interesting lectures.

Good teacher.  Knows his history like the back of his hand.  Tests have review sheets but were typically harder than anticipated.  Patton was sometimes unorganizes and almost always late to class.  Hard to get in touch with outside of class.
Awesome for GA Hist
